name: 5-formyl-2-methoxybenzeneboronic acid
Reason: 5-formyl-2-methoxybenzeneboronic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 2-methoxybenzene, which has a melting point of around 30 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 5-formyl-2-methoxybenzeneboronic acid will affect its melting point: (1) The methoxy group (Oc1ccccc1O) adds approximately +5 due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding; (2) The formyl group (C=O) adds approximately +5 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding; (3) The carboxylic acid group (C(=O)O) adds approximately +5 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding; (4) The methyl group (C) adds approximately +2 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
